Body:
I'm setting up SNS push notifications on AWS IoT for two MCU sensors.

Right now I am getting alerts just when the moisture is low so I wanted to include temp/humidity data but its either giving me a value of none or throwing an error Invalid JSON. How do I fix this?

Working code:

def myShadowUpdateCallback(payload, responseStatus, token):	  print()	  print('UPDATE: $aws/things/' + SHADOW_HANDLER +	    '/shadow/update/#')	  print(payload = " + payload)	  print("responseStatus = " + responseStatus)	  print("token = " + token)		channel = 21	GPIO.setup(channel
column9: GPIO.IN)		while True:		  if GPIO.input(channel):	    myDeviceShadow.shadowUpdate(	      '{"state":{"reported":{"moisture":"low"}}}'
column17:
clientToken:"b8a2"}

To get the DH22 temp/humidity sensor working I added:

import Adafruit_DHT		humidity
column21: token):	  print()	  print('UPDATE: $aws/things/' + SHADOW_HANDLER +	    '/shadow/update/#')	  print("payload = " + payload)	  print("responseStatus = " + responseStatus)	  print("token = " + token)	  print('Temperature={}*F  Humidity={}%'.format(temperature
column22: humidity))		while True:		  if GPIO.input(channel):	    myDeviceShadow.shadowUpdate(	      '{"state":{"reported":{"moisture":"low"
column30:
5)

Error:

When moisture is OK the temperature and moisture show:

Temperature=None*F  Humidity=None%

When moisture is low I get an error:

myShadowUpdateCallback

Body: maybe you can check around the line which raised the exception to see why it happens. Sometimes there are comments or obvious checks; The source is often very readable in those high level packages
You should use `lower_case_with_underscores` instead of `camelCase` for variable and function names in python. https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/

Looks like the part {0:0.1f} is no valid json. Maybe change it to something like {0":"0.1f"} or other valid json.

"
